intro: Eleocharis rabenii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spike-rush, is a flowering plant species native to wetland environments in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Eleocharis rabenii typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, often in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its reproductive structures are adapted for water dispersal, contributing to its ecological role in aquatic ecosystems.
